sentences.text: March 20, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DEAR FELLOW SHAREHOLDERS:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are cordially invited to attend Welltowers Annual Meeting of Shareholders, which will be held at 9:00 a.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Time on May 4, 2017 in the Bruce G. Thompson Auditorium at the Companys headquarters, located at 4500 Dorr Street, Toledo, Ohio 43615.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Details regarding admission to the meeting and the business to be conducted are more fully described in the accompanying Notice of Annual Meeting of Shareholders and Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I am honored to serve as your Chairman and feel incredibly proud to be a part of this remarkable company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board diligently reviews the Companys strategy, challenges, capabilities and leadership to ensure the Company is well-positioned to continue creating value for shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent directors and I are committed to, and value, our dialogue with our first-rate management team regarding the Companys disciplined portfolio review approach, capital allocation strategy and long-term plans for growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I encourage you to read more about our Board, governance structures and practices, and compensation programs in the Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote is very important to us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether or not you plan to attend the Annual Meeting, we hope you will vote as soon as possible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information about voting methods is set forth in the accompanying Notice of Annual Meeting of Shareholders and Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continue to focus on saving costs and protecting the environment by using the Notice and Access method of delivery.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead of receiving paper copies of our proxy materials in the mail, many shareholders will receive a Notice Regarding the Availability of Proxy Materials, which provides an Internet website address where shareholders can access electronic copies of the proxy materials and vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This website also has instructions for voting by phone and for requesting paper copies of the proxy materials and proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On behalf of everyone at Welltower, I thank you for your ongoing interest and investment in Welltower Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Jeffrey H. Donahue Chairman
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTICE OF ANNUAL MEETING OF SHAREHOLDERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TO THE SHAREHOLDERS OF WELLTOWER INC.:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Meeting of Shareholders of Welltower Inc. (the Annual Meeting) will be held on May 4, 2017 at 9:00 a.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Time in the Bruce G. Thompson Auditorium at Welltowers corporate headquarters, 4500 Dorr Street, Toledo, Ohio 43615, for the purpose of considering and acting upon:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. The election of ten directors named in the Proxy Statement accompanying this notice to hold office until the next Annual Meeting of Shareholders and until their respective successors have been duly elected and qualified;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. The ratification of the appointment of Ernst & Young LLP as independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. The advisory vote to approve executive compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. The advisory vote on the frequency of advisory votes on executive compensation; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The transaction of such other business as may properly come before the meeting or any adjournment thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors of Welltower Inc. unanimously recommends that you vote: (1) FOR each of the nominees for election to the Board (Proposal 1); (2) FOR the ratification of the appointment of Ernst & Young LLP as independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year 2017 (Proposal 2); (3) FOR the approval of executive compensation (Proposal 3); and (4) FOR the holding of advisory votes on executive compensation every year (Proposal 4).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders of record at the close of business on March 7, 2017 will be entitled to notice of, and to vote at, the Annual Meeting or any adjournment thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information relating to the matters to be considered and voted on at the Annual Meeting is set forth in the Proxy Statement accompanying this notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How does the Board of Directors recommend I vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As permitted by the rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission (the SEC), Welltower Inc. (the Company) is making these proxy materials available to shareholders primarily via the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By doing so, the Company reduces the printing and delivery costs and the environmental impact of its Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the Company is sending a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (the Notice) to the Companys shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice contains instructions on how to access the Companys proxy materials and how to vote online or by telephone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you would like to receive a paper copy of the proxy materials, please follow the instructions in the Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You must bring valid picture identification, such as a drivers license or passport, and you may be requested to provide proof of stock ownership as of March 7, 2017.

sentences.text: What proposals will be voted on at the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following proposals will be voted on at the Annual Meeting: (1) the election of ten directors (Proposal 1); (2) the ratification of the appointment of Ernst & Young LLP as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year 2017 (Proposal 2); (3) the advisory vote to approve executive compensation (Proposal 3); (4) the advisory vote on the frequency of advisory votes on executive compensation (Proposal 4); and (5) the transaction of such other business as may properly come before the Annual Meeting or any adjournment thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All shares that have been properly voted by proxy and not revoked will be voted at the Annual Meeting in accordance with the instructions contained in the proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares represented by proxy cards that are signed and returned without any voting instructions will be voted consistent with the Boards recommendations.

sentences.text: Any shareholder giving a proxy has the right to revoke it any time before it is voted by: (1) filing a written revocation with the Senior Vice President - General Counsel & Corporate Secretary of the Company; (2) filing a duly executed proxy bearing a later date; or (3) attending the Annual Meeting and voting in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A written revocation, as described in (1) above, will not be effective until the notice thereof has been received by the Senior Vice President - General Counsel & Corporate Secretary of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A broker non-vote occurs when a broker or other nominee holding shares for a beneficial owner votes on one proposal, but does not vote on another proposal because the broker does not have discretionary voting power for the other proposal and has not received instructions from the beneficial owner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker non-votes will be counted as present or represented for purposes of determining the presence or absence of a quorum for the Annual Meeting, but will not be counted for purposes of determining the number of shares entitled to vote with respect to any proposal for which the broker lacks discretionary authority.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Brokers do not have discretionary authority with respect to the election of the directors (Proposal 1), the advisory vote to approve executive compensation (Proposal 3), or the advisory vote on the frequency of holding advisory votes on executive compensation (Proposal 4).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has adopted an SEC-approved procedure called householding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this procedure, the Company delivers a single copy of the Notice and, if applicable, this Proxy Statement and the Annual Report to multiple shareholders who share the same address unless the Company receives contrary instructions from any shareholder at that address.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This procedure is designed to reduce printing and mailing costs and the environmental impact of the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What constitutes a quorum at the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The presence at the Annual Meeting, in person or by proxy, of the holders of a majority of the total number of shares of voting securities outstanding on the record date shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of business by such holders at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How will votes be tabulated at the Annual Meeting?

sentences.text: All votes will be tabulated by the inspector of election appointed for the Annual Meeting, who will separately tabulate affirmative and negative votes, abstentions and broker non-votes.

sentences.text: Representatives of Broadridge Financial Solutions, Inc. (Broadridge) will tabulate the votes and act as inspector of election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Matthew McQueen, Senior Vice President - General Counsel & Corporate Secretary of the Company, and Scott Estes, Executive Vice President - Chief Financial Officer of the Company, have been appointed to serve as alternate inspectors of election in the event Broadridge is unable to serve.

sentences.text: Proposal 1Election of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys By-Laws provide that the Board of Directors shall have nine members unless changed by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating/Corporate Governance Committee of the Board of Directors annually considers the size, composition and needs of the Board and recommends nominees for directors to the Board for approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Board increased the number of directors from nine to ten.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are ten Board nominees recommended for election at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The shares represented by the proxies will be voted for the election of each of the nominees named below, unless you indicate in the proxy that your vote should be cast against any or all of them or that you abstain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each nominee elected as a director will continue in office until his or her successor has been duly elected and qualified, or until the earliest of his or her resignation, removal or death.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any nominee declines or is unable to accept such nomination to serve as a director, events which the Board does not now expect, the proxies reserve the right to substitute another person as a Board nominee, or to reduce the number of Board nominees, as they shall deem advisable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BOARD LEADERSHIP STRUCTURE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board met six times during the year ended December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive sessions of independent directors are held after regularly scheduled meetings of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Donahue, the non-executive Chairman, presides at all such sessions or meetings of the independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is responsible for the selection of the Chairman of the Board and the Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes it is in the best interests of the Company for the Board to make a determination regarding whether to separate the roles of Chairman and Chief Executive Officer based upon the circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, these roles may be filled by one individual or by two different individuals (and during the course of its history, the Company has utilized each leadership model).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Nominating/Corporate Governance Committee facilitated a Board written evaluation and self-assessment process to evaluate the effectiveness of the Board, its committees and the Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In April 2014, the Board separated the roles of Chairman and Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes the current separation of the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer roles allows the Chief Executive Officer to focus his time and energy on operating and managing the Company and increases the Boards independent oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and its committees complete self-assessment questionnaires to evaluate the effectiveness in several areas including composition, structure and processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating/Corporate Governance Committee utilizes the results of this process to recommend changes to Board process, to determine critical skills required of prospective director candidates and to make recommendations for committee assignments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board periodically reviews and assesses the Companys leadership structure in connection with its review of succession planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During this review, the Board, in addition to its consideration of the separation of the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer roles, consults with Mr. DeRosa regarding future candidates for senior leadership positions, succession timing for those positions, and development plans for the candidates with the greatest potential.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This process facilitates a meaningful discussion regarding all senior leadership positions, ensures continuity of leadership over the long term and forms the basis on which the Company makes ongoing leadership assignments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Executive Officers below for a description of the roles, background and experience of the executive officers of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of the Boards desire to stay at the forefront of best practices and to give each member of the Board an opportunity to speak confidentially to an independent governance expert, the Board engaged an outside consultant in 2015 to conduct one-on-one confidential interviews with each Board member on a broad range of topics to assess the performance of the Board and its committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating/Corporate Governance Committee believes such interviews, conducted at least once every three years, coupled with the Boards written evaluation and self- assessment processes, optimize transparency and foster continued Board engagement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Donahue, the non-executive Chairman, presides at all meetings of the shareholders and of the Board of Directors.

sentences.text: INDEPENDENCE AND MEETINGS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board determined that all of the members of the Audit Committee (Mr. Klipsch, Mr. Meyers, Mr. Rivera and Mr. Trumbull) are independent under the general independence standards of the New York Stock Exchange and the Corporate Governance Guidelines and under the separate independence standards for audit committee members under Rule 10A-3 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has adopted Corporate Governance Guidelines that meet the listing standards adopted by the New York Stock Exchange and a Code of Business Conduct and Ethics that meets the New York Stock Exchanges listing standards and complies with the rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Guidelines and Code of Business Conduct and Ethics are available on the Companys website at www.welltower.com/investors/governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the Board determined that all of the members of the Compensation Committee (Mr. Bacon, Mr. Naughton, Ms. Oster and Ms. Pelham) are independent, non-employee and outside directors, as the case may be, under the rules of the New York Stock Exchange, Securities and Exchange Commission and Internal Revenue Service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the Corporate Governance Guidelines, the Board undertook a review of director independence in February 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During this review, the Board considered transactions and relationships between each director, or any member of his or her immediate family, and the Company and its subsidiaries and affiliates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of this review was to determine whether any relationships or transactions were inconsistent with a determination that a director is independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, the Board determined that all of the members of the Nominating/Corporate Governance Committee (Mr. Donahue, Mr. Klipsch, Mr. Meyers, Ms. Oster and Ms. Pelham) are independent under the rules of the New York Stock Exchange.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board determined that other than Mr. DeRosa, all of the directors (Mr. Bacon, Mr. Donahue, Mr. Klipsch, Mr. Meyers, Mr. Naughton, Ms. Oster, Ms. Pelham, Mr. Rivera and Mr. Trumbull) meet the specific minimum independence requirements of the New York Stock Exchange.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also determined that other than Mr. DeRosa, all of the directors (Mr. Bacon, Mr. Donahue, Mr. Klipsch, Mr. Meyers, Mr. Naughton, Ms. Oster, Ms. Pelham, Mr. Rivera and Mr. Trumbull) have no material relationship with the Company (either directly or as a partner, shareholder or officer of an organization that has a relationship with the Company) and are therefore independent under the general independence standards of the New York Stock Exchange and the Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. DeRosa is not independent because he is the Chief Executive Officer of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the candidate is approved by the Nominating/Corporate Governance Committee, the candidate will have an opportunity to meet with the remaining directors and management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the end of this process, if the Nominating/Corporate Governance Committee determines that the candidate will be able to add value to the Board and the candidate expresses his or her interest in serving on the Board, the Nominating/Corporate Governance Committee will then recommend to the Board that the candidate stand for election by the shareholders or fill a vacancy or newly created position on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the Board and the Nominating/Corporate Governance Committee evaluate the size, composition and diversity of the Board as part of the Board and Committee self-evaluation process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These self-evaluations help the Nominating/Corporate Governance Committee assess the effectiveness of the foregoing procedures for identifying and evaluating nominees for director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating/Corporate Governance Committee will consider qualified nominees recommended by shareholders who may submit recommendations to the Nominating/Corporate Governance Committee in care of the Senior Vice President - General Counsel & Corporate Secretary, Welltower Inc., 4500 Dorr Street, Toledo, Ohio 43615.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating/Corporate Governance Committee requires that shareholder recommendations for director nominees be submitted by November 24, 2017 and be accompanied by (1) the name, age, business address and, if known, residence address of the nominee, (2) the principal occupation or employment of the nominee for at least the last five years and a description of the qualifications of the nominee, (3) the class or series and number of shares of the Companys stock that are owned beneficially or of record by the nominee and (4) any other information relating to the nominee that is required to be disclosed in solicitations for proxies for election of directors under Regulation 14A of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, together with a written statement from the nominee that he or she is willing to be nominated and desires to serve, if elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In identifying and evaluating nominees for director, the Nominating/Corporate Governance Committee first looks at the overall size and structure of the Board each year to determine the need to add or remove directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Second, taking into consideration the characteristics mentioned above, the Nominating/Corporate Governance Committee determines if there are any specific qualities or skills that would complement the existing strengths of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating/Corporate Governance Committee takes diversity into account in identifying and evaluating nominees for director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating/Corporate Governance Committee considers diversity in terms of (1) professional experience, including experience in the Companys primary business segments and in areas of possible future expansion, (2) educational background and (3) age, race, gender and national origin.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating/Corporate Governance Committee uses multiple sources for identifying and evaluating nominees for director, including referrals from current directors and management, and may seek input from third party executive search firms retained at the Companys expense.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Nominating/Corporate Governance Committee retains one or more search firms, such firms may be asked to identify possible nominees, interview and screen such nominees and act as a liaison between the Nominating/Corporate Governance Committee and each nominee during the screening and evaluation process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also, the shareholder making the nomination should include (1) his or her name and record address, together with the name and address of any other shareholder known to be supporting the nominee and (2) the class or series and number of shares of the Companys stock that are owned beneficially or of record by the shareholder making the nomination and by any other supporting shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominees for director who are recommended by shareholders will be evaluated in the same manner as any other nominee for director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating/Corporate Governance Committee will review the rsum and qualifications of each candidate based on the criteria described above and determine whether the candidate would add value to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to candidates that are determined by the Nominating/Corporate Governance Committee to be potential nominees, the Nominating/Corporate Governance Committee will obtain such background and reference checks as it deems necessary, and the Chair of the Nominating/Corporate Governance Committee and the Chairman of the Board will interview qualified candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company is focused on effectively managing its resource consumption, GHG emissions and environmental impacts.

sentences.text: The Company seeks to build, improve and operate its real estate portfolio to reach the highest possible efficiency and quality standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To ensure a comprehensive sustainability program, the Company engages and incorporates the interests of its communities and stakeholders in its business priorities wherever possible.

sentences.text: Finally, the Company is committed to conducting its affairs with integrity and transparency.

sentences.text: RISK MANAGEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors and Leadership Team play a vital role in overseeing the management of the Companys risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board reviews the Companys significant risk exposure, including operational, strategic, financial, legal, environmental sustainability and regulatory risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Leadership Team is responsible for identification, assessment and management of risks, and has established an Enterprise Risk Management Committee to assure that appropriate risk identification and mitigation procedures are incorporated into the daily activities and decision-making of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is led by the Senior Vice President - General Counsel & Corporate Secretary and includes three additional members of the Leadership Team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, periodic risk reviews are performed with business unit leaders to review the likelihood of adverse effects, the potential impact of those risks, risk tolerances and mitigating measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has grown its sustainability program transparency efforts by completing the CDP and GRESB surveys and by publishing its fourth corporate social responsibility report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Company enhanced its sustainability reporting by completing the ROBECOSAM-DJSI Survey in 2016 for the first time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company is committed to the ongoing improvement of its sustainability program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These efforts were recognized by GRESB as the Company continues to be listed on the Green Star List.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company remains in the CDP leadership band, scoring an A-.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys sustainability performance was also recognized with its inclusion in the DJSI North American Index.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, the Company was recognized as the 2016 Leader in the Light for the Health Care Real Estate sector by NAREIT.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company continued to expand and enhance its sustainability management system and governance by adding sustainability oversight to the Boards Nominating/Corporate Governance Committee Charter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board meets at regular intervals with the Leadership Team and key members of management with primary responsibility for risk management to review the Companys significant risk exposures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CLAWBACK POLICY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating/Corporate Governance Committee has approved a process for handling letters received by the Company and addressed to members of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under that process, the Senior Vice President - General Counsel & Corporate Secretary of the Company reviews all such correspondence and regularly forwards to the Board a summary of the correspondence (with copies of the correspondence attached) that, in the opinion of the Senior Vice President - General Counsel & Corporate Secretary, relates to the functions of the Board or committees thereof or that he otherwise determines requires their attention (for example, if the communication received relates to questions, concerns or complaints regarding accounting, internal control over financial reporting and auditing matters, it will be summarized and forwarded to the Chair of the Audit Committee for review).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policies and Procedures for Review, Approval or Ratification of Related Party Transactions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has a written policy requiring all material transactions with related parties to be approved or ratified by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy covers any transaction, arrangement or relationship or series of similar transactions, arrangements or relationships (including any indebtedness or guarantee of indebtedness) in which (1) the aggregate amount involved will or may be expected to exceed $100,000 in any calendar year, (2) the Company is a participant, and (3) any related party has or will have a direct or indirect interest (other than solely as a result of being a director or a less than 10% beneficial owner of another entity).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: proxy statement under Item 402 of Regulation S-K because the person is a Named Executive Officer, or if the executive officer is not a Named Executive Officer and the compensation would have been reported in the Companys proxy statement if the executive officer had been a Named Executive Officer (and the Companys Compensation Committee approved or recommended that the Board approve such compensation).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also has pre-approved certain transactions that involve (1) any compensation paid to a director if the compensation is required to be reported in the Companys proxy statement under Item 402 of Regulation S-K; (2) any charitable contribution, grant or endowment by the Company to a charitable organization, foundation or university at which a related persons only relationship is as an employee (other than an executive officer) or a director, if the aggregate amount involved does not exceed the lesser of $1,000,000 or 2% of the charitable organizations total annual receipts; and (3) any transaction where the related partys interest arises solely from the ownership of the Companys common stock and all holders of the Companys common stock receive the same benefit on a pro rata basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining whether to approve or ratify a transaction, the Board will take into account, among other factors it deems appropriate, whether the transaction is on terms no less favorable than terms generally available to an unaffiliated third party under the same or similar circumstances and the extent of the related partys interest in the transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that transactions that involve any employment by the Company of an executive officer of the Company shall be deemed to be pre-approved if the related compensation is required to be reported in the Companys

sentences.text: Proposal 2Ratification of the Appointment of the Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has selected Ernst & Young LLP to serve as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm for the year ending December 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ernst & Young LLP has served as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm since the Companys inception in 1970.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee periodically considers whether, in order to assure continuing auditor independence, it should adopt a policy requiring the regular rotation of the independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee (and in particular the Chair of the Audit Committee) ensures the rotation of the lead (or coordinating) audit partner every five years as mandated by the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, as amended, and is directly involved in the selection of Ernst & Young LLPs lead audit partner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys current lead audit partner was appointed beginning with the 2013 audit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee and the Board believe that the continued retention of Ernst & Young LLP as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm is in the best interests of the Company and its shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is directly responsible for the appointment, retention, compensation, evaluation and oversight of the Companys independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee considers whether the independent registered public accounting firm is best positioned and qualified to provide the most effective and efficient service, based on factors such as the independent registered public accounting firms familiarity with the Companys business, personnel, culture, accounting systems or risk profile; the appropriateness of fees charged; and whether provision of the service by the independent registered public accounting firm would enhance the Companys ability to manage or control risk or improve audit quality.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee obtains and reviews a report from the independent registered public accounting firm at least annually regarding:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) the independent registered public accounting firms internal quality-control procedures,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) any material issues raised by the most recent internal quality-control review, or peer review, of the independent registered public accounting firm, or by any inquiry or investigation by governmental or professional authorities within the preceding five years respecting one or more independent audits carried out by the independent registered public accounting firm, and any steps taken to deal with any such issues, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) all relationships between the independent registered public accounting firm and the Company (in order to assess the independent registered public accounting firms independence).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee evaluates the qualifications, performance and independence of the independent registered public accounting firm, including considering whether its quality controls are adequate and the provision of permitted non-audit services is compatible with maintaining its independence, and taking into account the opinions of management and the internal auditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the submission of this matter for approval by shareholders is not legally required, the Board believes that such submission follows sound business practice and is in the best interests of the shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If this appointment is not ratified by the holders of a majority of the shares of voting securities present in person or by proxy at the Annual Meeting, the Audit Committee will consider the selection of another accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If such a selection were made, it may not become effective until 2018 because of the difficulty and expense of making a substitution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Representatives of the firm of Ernst & Young LLP are expected to be present at the Annual Meeting and will have an opportunity to make a statement if they so desire and will be available to respond to appropriate questions.

sentences.text: Pre-Approval Policies and Procedures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has developed policies and procedures concerning its pre-approval of the performance of audit and non-audit services for the Company by Ernst & Young LLP and is responsible for the audit fee negotiations associated with the engagement of Ernst & Young LLP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At its quarterly meetings, the Audit Committee pre-approves particular audit and non-audit services within the following categories of services that it desires the independent registered public accounting firm to undertake: audit services, audit-related services, tax compliance services, tax planning and tax advice services and other services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to giving its approval, the Committee reviews the written descriptions of these services provided by Ernst & Young LLP and the estimated fees for these services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All other non-audit services must be pre-approved on an individual engagement basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If there is any question as to whether a proposed service has been pre-approved, management and the independent registered public accounting firm together must contact the Audit Committee to obtain clarification or, if necessary, pre-approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the audit services, audit-related services, tax compliance services, tax planning and tax advice services and other services provided to the Company by Ernst & Young LLP during the year ended December 31, 2016 were pre-approved by the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Where specific Audit Committee approval of non-audit services is required, the Chair of the Audit Committee may pre-approve the engagement subject to a presentation to the full Audit Committee at its next regularly scheduled meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee Report
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee oversees the Companys financial reporting process on behalf of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management has the primary responsibility for the financial statements and the reporting process, including the system of internal controls.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fulfilling its oversight responsibilities this past year, the Audit Committee reviewed the audited financial statements with management, including a discussion of the quality, not just the acceptability, of the accounting principles, the reasonableness of significant judgments and the clarity of disclosures in the financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: independence.

sentences.text: The Audit Committee discussed with the Companys independent registered public accounting firm the overall scope and plans for its audit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee met with such firm, with and without management present, to discuss the results of its examinations, its evaluations of the Companys internal controls, and the overall quality of the Companys financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee held four meetings during the year ended December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee reviewed with the independent registered public accounting firm, which is responsible for expressing an opinion on the conformity of the audited financial statements with generally accepted accounting principles, its judgments as to the quality, not just the acceptability, of the Companys accounting principles and such other matters as are required to be discussed with the Audit Committee under generally accepted auditing standards (including Auditing Standard No. 1301, Communications with Audit Committees issued by the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Audit Committee has received the written disclosures and the letter from the independent registered public accounting firm required by applicable requirements of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board regarding such firms communications with the Audit Committee concerning
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 3Advisory Vote to Approve Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the requirements of Section 14A of the Exchange Act, the Companys shareholders have the opportunity to vote to approve, on an advisory or non-binding basis, the compensation of the Named Executive Officers as disclosed in this Proxy Statement in accordance with the SECs compensation disclosure rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys compensation programs, which are detailed in Executive CompensationCompensation Discussion and Analysis in this Proxy Statement, are designed to link pay to performance and to reward the Named Executive Officers for the achievement of short-term and long-term strategic and operational goals and increased shareholder returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This compensation philosophy is central to the Companys abilit to attract, retain and motivate individuals who can achieve superior financial results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This approach, which has been used consistently over the years, has resulted in the Companys ability to attract and retain the executive talent necessary to guide the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please refer to Executive CompensationExecutive Summary in this Proxy Statement for an overview of the compensation of the Named Executive Officers and the Companys key financial and strategic achievements in 2016 that drove compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also encourage shareholders to read the Executive CompensationCompensation Discussion and Analysis in this Proxy Statement, which describes the details of the Companys compensation programs and the decisions made by the Compensation Committee in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders are being asked to vote on the following advisory resolution
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Resolved, that the compensation paid to the Companys Named Executive Officers as disclosed in this Proxy Statement in accordance with the SECs compensation disclosure rules, which disclosures include the disclosures under Executive Compensation Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the compensation tables and the narrative disclosures that accompany the compensation tables, is hereby approved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This vote is not intended to address any specific item of compensation, but rather the overall compensation of the Named Executive Officers and the policies and practices described in this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This vote is advisory and therefore not binding on the Company, the Board of Directors or the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and the Compensation Committee value the opinions of the Companys shareholders and to the extent there is any significant vote against the Named Executive Officers compensation as disclosed in this Proxy Statement, the Company will consider shareholders concerns, and the Compensation Committee will evaluate whether any actions are necessary to address those concerns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 14A of the Exchange Act also enables the Companys shareholders to vote at least once every six years, on an advisory or non-binding basis, on how frequently they would like to cast an advisory vote on the compensation of the Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By voting on this proposal, shareholders may indicate whether they would prefer an advisory vote on Named Executive Officer compensation once every one, two, or three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2011, the Companys shareholders voted in favor of holding advisory votes on executive compensation every year and the Board implemented this standard.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends that shareholders approve continuing to hold the advisory vote on executive compensation every year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that conducting an advisory vote on executive compensation on an annual basis is appropriate for the Company and its shareholders at this time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This will allow the shareholders to provide timely, direct input on the Companys executive compensation philosophy, policies and practices as disclosed in the proxy statement each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board will carefully consider the outcome of the vote when making future decisions regarding the frequency of advisory votes on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, because this vote is advisory and not binding, the Board may decide that it is in the best interests of the Company and its shareholders to hold an advisory vote more or less frequently than the alternative that has been selected by the shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders may cast their advisory vote to conduct advisory votes on executive compensation every 1 Year, 2 Years, 3 Years, or Abstain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is expected that the next vote on the frequency of holding advisory votes on executive compensation will occur at the 2023 annual meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION PRINCIPLES The Companys executive compensation program is designed to attract, motivate and retain top executive talent.

sentences.text: Competing successfully in his dynamic sector requires highly skilled, knowledgeable individuals who are committed to delivering outstanding shareholder returns while effectively building relationships across the industry.

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee continually reviews and refines the Companys compensation practices so that the compensation system is in line with the market, is responsive to concerns of shareholders, and takes into account best compensation practices.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Completed the implementation of an executive long-term incentive program that measures Company achievement over a forward- looking, multi-year performance period.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company had a strong year in 2016 that validated the strength of its platform.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys strategy is based on acquiring and developing a well-diversified, high quality portfolio located in strong high barrier to entry and growing markets operated or managed by best-in-class seniors housing and care organizations and health systems.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company significantly improved its balance sheet, portfolio and risk profile through strategic acquisitions and dispositions during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee evaluates all pre-established qualitative and quantitative metrics and factors in making its compensation decisions.

sentences.text: Among the important metrics and factors the Compensation Committee considered were the management teams success in the following areas:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GROWTH
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Delivered strong annual earnings growth in 2016, including normalized funds from operations growth and normalized funds available for distribution growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generated strong same-store net operating income growth across the portfolio in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Outpatient Medical portfolio generated solid NOI growth, supported by strong occupancy of 95% at year-end and a tenant retention rate of 87% for the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PORTFOLIO AND BALANCE SHEET
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Completed $3.0 billion in pro rata gross new investments during the year, including $1.15 billion premier West Coast seniors housing portfolio (page 34).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Significantly improved the portfolio quality by disposing of nearly $2.8 billion of non-strategic assets (page 35)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Improved key balance sheet metrics, including net debt to undepreciated book capitalization (37.4% at the end of 2016 as compared to 39.5% at the end of 2015) (page 35).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Received corporate credit ratings upgrades from two rating agencies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Paid a cash dividend of $3.44 per share in 2016, which represents an increase of 4% over dividends paid during 2015 (page 36).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Enhanced financial flexibility with expanded, extended and lower-priced $3.7 billion unsecured credit facility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SUSTAINABILITY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Named to the Dow Jones North America Sustainability Index (DJSI).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DJSI is considered among the most important global indicato of sustainability performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Designated as a Global Real Estate Sustainability Benchmark (GRESB) Green Star for sustainability performance for second consecutive year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Received the NAREIT Leader in the Light (health care) award, which recognizes companies that have demonstrated superior and sustained sustainability practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Received recognition for 29 additional outpatient medical buildings for their sustainability leadership through the Green Arrow Building Certification (GABC) program.

sentences.text: 1. COMPENSATION PHILOSOPHY AND OBJECTIVES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The philosophy underlying the Companys executive compensation program is to provide competitive pay for achieving rigorous performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The objective is to attract and retain the caliber of executive officers and other key employees necessary for the Company to deliver sustained high performance to shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The short-term and long-term metrics built into the compensation program are specifically designed to align management and shareholder interests directly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Outlined below are the principles underlying the Companys executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: periods    Payouts vary based upon the degree to which performance measures are achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Multiple performance measures are used to ensure a focus on overall Company perform
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Multiple performance measures are used to ensure a focus on overall Company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Variable reward payouts are designed to provide competitive compensation for achieving expected performance, and enhanced compensation for performance that exceeds expectations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ttract and retain top management talent    The executive compensation program is structured to attract and retain individuals with the skills necessary to effectively manage a complex, growing international business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee regularly benchmarks its executive compensation program to compensate executives to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Link compensation realized to the achievement of the Companys short and long-term financial and strategic goals
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: and increase shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual compensation may be above or below the targeted level, depending on achievement relative to pre-established performance goals that reflect the Companys short and long-term business plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Align management and shareholder interests by engaging in long-term shareholder value creation    Long-term incentive awards are granted in the form of equity awards that vest based on performan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: emphasizing both short and long-term shareholder value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock ownership guidelines require that Board members and executives maintain significant levels of stock ownership, further emphasizing the focus on long-term shareholder return and alignment with shareholder interests.

sentences.text: 2. POLICIES AND PROCEDURES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is responsible for determining the nature and amount of compensation for the Companys Chief Executive Officer and for reviewing and approving the compensation for the other four executive officers listed on page 17.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee consists of four non-employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Oster is the Chair of the Compensation Committee and Mr. Bacon, Mr. Naughton and Ms. Pelham are Compensation Committee members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys compensation policies and programs are designed to implement the philosophy described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has implemented a number of measures in an effort to drive performance and align the interests of the Companys executives with shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Guarantee salary increases, bonuses or equity grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not guarantee annual salary increases or bonuses to anyone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It currently has no guaranteed commitments to grant any equity-based awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, the entire long-term program is predicated on the achievement of performance metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This ensures that the Company is able to base all compensation awards on measurable performance factors and business results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dividends or dividend equivalents on unearned performance shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance share award agreements do not provide for the payment of dividends until the shares are earned.

sentences.text: misstated financial information.

sentences.text: 9. CEO PAY OVERVIEW
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This section highlights the terms of Mr. DeRosas amended and restated employment agreement, which was entered into on January 3, 2017 and will become effective on April 13, 2017, and outlines the compensation paid to him in 2016 in light of the Companys performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. DeRosas Amended and Restated Employment Agreement In 2016, the Company had an employment agreement with Thomas J. DeRosa, Chief Executive Officer of the Company, which expires on April 13, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under that original employment agreement, Mr. DeRosa receives a base salary that is reviewed and adjusted each year by the Compensation Committee and he is eligible to receive discretionary annual bonuses and equity awards under the Companys long-term incentive plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company also provides Mr. DeRosa with an automobile allowance to cover the cost of leasing a vehicle during the term of his employment agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. DeRosa received a one-time grant of $1,000,000 of performance-based restricted stock units (15,618 units) on July 30, 2014 in connection with the commencement of his employment as CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See the 2016 Nonqualified Deferred Compensation Table on page 54 for additional information regarding these performance-based restricted stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, to the extent the Company no longer maintains the health plan in which Mr. DeRosa is participating as of May 1, 2014 and, if he elects to not participate in any other group health plan sponsored or maintained by the Company, he may receive a cash payment in lieu of such benefits up to $2,000 per month.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. DeRosa is entitled to severance protections and benefits in connection with certain qualifying termination events, some of which are enhanced following a change in corporate control of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a description of the provisions of the agreement regarding compensation and benefits payable upon termination or a change in corporate control, see Potential Payments Upon Termination or Change in Corporate Control on pages 55-56.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In anticipation of the expiration of his original employment agreement and in recognition of his exemplary performance, on January 3, 2017, the Company entered into a new employment agreement with Mr. DeRosa, which will become effective on April 13, 2017, after the expiration of his current employment agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As was the case under Mr. DeRosas original employment agreement that was in effect during 2016, his amended and restated employment agreement includes the provisions listed below, which the Company considers best practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BEST PRACTICES CEO EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No evergreenterm is defined and there is no automatic renewal feature
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No severance payable upon expiration of the term
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No automatic compensation increases
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No guaranteed bonus payments
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any severance payments are conditioned upon a general release and continued compliance with non-competition, nonsolicitation and confidentiality requirements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Double-trigger required for both severance and acceleration of equity awards following a change in corporate control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No excise tax gross-ups
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Limited perquisites and no perquisites upon retirement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to his amended and restated employment agreement, Mr. DeRosa will continue to serve as the Chief Executive Officer of the Company until April 13, 2020.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He will receive an annual base salary of $1,000,000, together with a target bonus opportunity under the Companys annual cash bonus program equal to 175% of his annual base salary and long-term stock awards under terms and conditions determined by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company will also reimburse Mr. DeRosa for reasonable costs of an annual medical exam and continue to provide an automobile allowance during the term of his employment agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: His severance protections under his new employment agreement essentially remain the same as the severance protections afforded by his original employment agreement that was in effect in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In negotiating the terms of Mr. DeRosas new employment agreement, the Compensation Committee took into account Mr. DeRosas exemplary performance over the course of the first three years of his tenure as Chief Executive Officer, which included his successful vision, eadership, interaction with the investment community and strong track record of financial performance (including strong normalized funds from operations growth, same-store net operating income growth and improvements to key balance sheet metrics), combined with the Compensation Committees desire to adjust his pay from ranking as the lowest of the peer group to a total opportunity that approximates the market median (which is consistent with market best practices).

sentences.text: Annual Incentives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual incentives reward the executives for the achievement of certain performance objectives tied to the Companys annual business plan, as well as achievement of individual performance objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this program, a range of earnings opportunities is established for each executive at the beginning of the performance period, expressed as percentages of base salary and corresponding to three levels of performance (threshold, target and high).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The rigorous corporate performance measures and weightings set by the Compensation Committee for 2016 under the annual incentive program were as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Normalized Funds from Operations (FFO) per share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Weighting   2016 Goal:    Threshold:  $4.45, +1.6% growth   Target:  $4.55, +3.9% growth   High:  $4.65, +6.2% growth
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why the Company chose this measure:  FFO is a common non-GAAP measure of earnings performance for REITs because it provides insight into the earnings generated from the real estate platform.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FFO means net income attributable to common stockholders, computed in accordance with U.S. GAAP, excluding gains (or losses) from sales of real estate and impairments of depreciable assets, plus real estate depreciation and amortization, and after adjustments for unconsolidated entities and noncontrolling interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Normalized FFO for 2016 represents FFO adjusted for transaction costs, provision for loan losses, net gains (or losses) on derivatives and extinguishments of debt, nonrecurring income tax benefits, certain other expenses or income and normalizing items relating to unconsolidated/noncontrolling interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This measure is included in the compensation program because it is the measure most commonly used by analysts to assess the performance of REITs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Company achieves a level of normalized FFO per share as a result of inappropriate amounts of leverage, the Compensation Committee may determine that bonuses should not be paid for this goal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How the Compensation Committee set the 2016 goal:  In its 2016 initial public guidance, the Company projected normalized FFO in a range of $4.50 to $4.60 per diluted share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target performance was set at $4.55 or the midpoint of the initial guidance range.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The range of $0.10 around target results in a threshold of $4.45 and a high of $4.65.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The high score was set at $0.05 above the high end of initial public guidance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: High performance would only be achieved if the Company significantly exceeded the high end of such guidance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Same Store NOI Growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Weighting   2016 Goal:    Threshold:  +2.0%   Target:  +3.0%   High:  +4.0%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why the Company chose this measure:  Net operating income (NOI) is used to evaluate the operating performance of the Companys properties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOI means total revenues, including tenant reimbursements, less property operating expenses, which represent costs associated with managing, maintaining and servicing tenants for the Companys seniors housing operating and outpatient medical properties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Same store NOI (SSNOI) is used to evaluate the operating performance of the Companys properties under a consistent population which eliminates changes in the composition of the portfolio.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of SSNOI, same store is generally defined as those revenue-generating properties in the portfolio for the relevant year-over-year reporting periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Land parcels, loans, sub-leases and any properties acquired, developed/redeveloped, transitioned, sold or classified as held for sale during those periods are excluded from the same store amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SSNOI
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: represents NOI for same store properties adjusted for elimination of non-cash NOI, adjustments to translate Canadian properties at a USD/CAD rate of 1.3495 and UK properties at a GBP/USD rate of 1.4950, adjustments to reflect consistent ownership percentages, and other adjustments as disclosed in the Companys quarterly financial supplements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How the Compensation Committee set the 2016 goal:  In its 2016 initial public guidance, the Company projected blended SSNOI growth in a range of 2.5%-3.0%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee set target performance at 3.0% or the high end of the initial guidance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The range of 1.0% around target results in a threshold of 2.0% and a high of 4.0%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The high score is a full 1.0% greater than the initial public guidance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leverage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Weighting   2016 Goal:    Threshold: 42.0%   Target: 39.5%   High: 37.0%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why the Company chose this measure:  For 2016, the Company has included a leverage measure (net debt to undepreciated book capitalization) to emphasize balance sheet strength, which has been a hallmark of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes it is important that the Company does not sacrifice its balance sheet to grow in other areas of the business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net debt to undepreciated book capitalization is a ratio (expressed as a percentage) of net debt to undepreciated book capitalization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net debt represents total debt less cash and cash equivalents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Undepreciated book capitalization represents net debt plus total equity (including noncontrolling interests), after adding back accumulated depreciation and amortization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How the Compensation Committee set the 2016 goal:  The Compensation Committee set target performance for leverage at 39.5%, which is consistent with leverage at the end of 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The range of 2.5% around target results in a threshold of 42.0% and a high score of 37.0%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash NOI of 2015 Operating Acquisitions vs. Underwritten Projections.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Weighting   2016 Goal:    Threshold:  >90% of underwritten projections   Target:  >100% of underwritten projections   High:  >110% of underwritten projections
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why the Company chose this measure:  This measure compares the cash NOI of the Companys 2015 operating acquisitions against underwritten expectations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash NOI represents NOI (as defined on page 39) as adjusted for the elimination of certain non-cash items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Operating acquisitions is a term used to encompass RIDEA investments and outpatient medical investments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company chose to limit the metric to operating acquisitions because they are the only investments over which it has influence on operating budgets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes it is appropriate to align the integration and success of recent investments with managements annual incentive measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This measure also serves to help bridge part of the gap left by the SSNOI measure, which only includes investments that have been in the portfolio for certain year-over-year reporting periods as discussed on page 39.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How the Compensation Committee set the 2016 goal:  The Compensation Committee believes the Company should reach or exceed 100% of its expected underwritten Cash NOI projections for the 2015 operating acquisitions in order to achieve target performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Threshold performance (greater than 90% of expected Cash NOI) represents solid performance for these investments (in light of the Companys high expectations) and high performance (greater than 110% of expected Cash NOI) represents excellent performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys long-term incentive plan consists of rolling three-year forward-looking programs, including the 2015-2017 and 2016-2018 programs and a similar program for 2017-2019, which examine performance across pre-determined key financial metrics (as detailed below).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These programs balance both absolute and relative performance and examine how the Company performs across multiple criteria spanning total shareholder return (the largest portion of the program), leverage, growth and revenue sources.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes the long-term incentive program fosters sustained performance and creates short and long-term shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the program, dividends on any unearned shares are not paid until and unless the underlying shares vest, which the Compensation Committee believes is in line with best practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Taken as a whole, this program emphasizes a pay-for-performance philosophy and promotes enhanced retention of executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive officers are required to own shares of the Companys common stock with a fair market value of at least three times their base salary five times for the Chief Executive Officer).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee directors are required to own shares of the Companys common stock with a fair market value of at least four times the annual cash fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares owned directly and indirectly, restricted shares and deferred stock units count owards these ownership requirements, but unexercised stock options do not.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive officers have five years from their date of hire to achieve the required ownership level and non-employee directors have five years from their date of appointment or February 7, 2013, whichever is later, to achieve the required ownership level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, each of the NEOs and the non-employee directors were n compliance with these ownership requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Deductibility of Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has considered the anticipated tax treatment to the Company regarding the compensation and benefits paid to the NEOs under Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the Code).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, Section 162(m) places a limit on the amount of compensation that may be deducted annually by the Company with respect to certain executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee will strive to provide executive officers with attractive, well-designed compensation packages that will generally preserve the deductibility of such payments for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain types of compensation payments and their deductibility depend upon the timing of an executive officers vesting or exercise of previously granted rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Moreover, interpretations of any changes in the tax laws and other factors beyond the Compensation Committees control may affect the deductibility of certain compensation payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the Company operates in such a manner that it will qualify as a REIT under the Code, and therefore is not subject to federal income taxes to the extent the Company distributes at least 90% of its REIT taxable income, the possible loss of this deduction would not be expected to have material adverse consequences for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If deductibility becomes an issue, the Compensation Committee will consider various alternatives to preserve the deductibility of compensation payments to executive officers and benefits to the extent reasonably practical and to the extent consistent with its other compensation objectives, but the Compensation Committee reserves the right to make incentive-based awards not exempt from these limits where such awards are appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the employment agreements for Mr. Estes and Mr. Miller, as of December 31, 2016, if any payments constitute excess parachute payments under Section 280G of the Code such that the executive incurs an excise tax under Section 4999 of the Code, the Company would provide an excise tax gross-up payment in an amount such that after payment of the excise tax and all income and excise taxes applicable to the gross-up payment, the executive would receive the same amount of severance had the excise tax not applied.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a change in corporate control had occurred on December 31, 2016 and each of the Named Executive Officers was terminated as a result, none of these Named Executive Officers would have been subject to excise tax.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In arriving at this conclusion, the following assumptions were used:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each officers base amount was calculated by taking the average W-2 income (box 1) from the past five years (2011-2015).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The stock award parachute calculations for purposes of Code Section 280G were based on Black-Scholes valuation methodology using the most recent GAAP ASC Topic 718 option valuation assumptions (volatility of 25.85%, risk-free interest rate of 1.78%, dividend yield of 5.2%, and expected remaining term of 4.4 years).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Code Section 280G rules, the cost included in the parachute for the accelerated vesting of stock options, restricted shares and unvested dividend equivalent rights is the sum of (1) the excess of the aggregate accelerated benefit over the present value of the accelerated benefit and (2) the lapse of service obligation (1% times the number of months of vesting accelerated times the aggregate accelerated benefit).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The total parachute for each Named Executive Officer did not exceed the Code Section 280G safe harbor, which is three times the base amount minus $1.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, these Named Executive Officers would not have incurred any excise tax.
