sentences.text: Risk Management and Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described above in Executive CompensationCompensation Discussion and Analysis, the Companys compensation programs are designed, among other things, to encourage long-term shareholder value creation, rather than short-term shareholder value maximization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance is evaluated based on quantitative and qualitative factors and there is a review of not only what is achieved, but also how it is achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with this long-term focus, the compensation policies and practices for the NEOs and other employees do not encourage excessive risk-taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fact, many elements of the executive compensation program serve to mitigate excessive risk-taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Balanced pay mix.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A balanced mix of base salary, annual cash incentives and long-term equity compensation is provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentives tied to annual performance are balanced with incentives tied to multi-year performance, as measured by total shareholder return on an absolute basis and relative to two indices in the long-term incentive programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this way, the executive officers are motivated to consider the impact of decisions over the short, intermediate and long terms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Balanced performance measurements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance measures used in the annual and long-term incentive programs were chosen to provide appropriate safeguards against maximization of a single performance goal at the expense of the overall health of the Companys business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The incentive programs are not completely quantitative.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Various individual and qualitative objectives are incorporated, and the Compensation Committee has the discretion to adjust earned bonuses based on the quality of the results as well as individual performance and behaviors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive payments are capped.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual and long-term incentive programs do not have unlimited upside potential.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term incentive grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted shares, which are well-aligned with shareholders because they have both upside potential and downside risk, make up 100% of the total value of the long-term incentive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed in Corporate GovernanceClawback Policy, the executive officers and certain other covered officers are subject to a clawback policy, which allows the Company to recover incentive compensation (including stock options, restricted stock and restricted stock units) received by such officers in the event the Company is required to prepare a financial restatement due to the Companys material non-compliance with any financial reporting requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock ownership requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed in Executive CompensationCompensation Discussion and AnalysisOwnership Guidelines the executive officers are subject to stock ownership guidelines based on a multiple of base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These stock ownership guidelines align the interests of management with long-term shareholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To confirm the effectiveness of its approach to compensation, from time to time the Company reviews the potential risks associated with the structure and design of its various compensation plans and programs for all employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
